results.title: Fields of space
results.creator_credit: Sidney Goldsmith and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A revelation of the distant universe, accomplishing through film animation what even the most far-seeing telescope cannot do. The film explores the fourth state of matter, the plasma that fills the infinite void between stars and galaxies. Single atoms in space, or planets as large as the sun, are each seen to have their own magnetic fields, attracting to themselves streams of invisible particles just as iron filings are drawn to a magnet. This has the same awe-inspiring quality as the earlier Universe, with color adding to its wonder and dimension.

results.title: Fiddle-de-dee = Fiddle de dee
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: With animation by Norman McLaren, this experimental film is described as a film fantasy of dancing music and dancing colour. It is an abstract interpretation in colour of the music “Listen to the Mocking Bird” played by an old time fiddler and recorded on the soundtrack. Norman McLaren, painting on film, translates sound into sight, resulting in colours rippling, flowing, flickering and blending along with the music. (Awards: Brussels; Rome; Salerno).

results.title: Fibrous plaster in Australia
results.creator_credit: John Kenyon, Gateway Film Productions and M K and M Pictures
results.brief_description: Shows the mining of gypsum in South Australia, calcining for plaster, harvesting of sisal in eastern Africa for fibre, manufacture of fibrous plaster sheets and forms, and their fixing and joining in modern building construction.

results.title: Fiber in art = Fibre in art
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Paul Burnford Film Productions
results.brief_description: Part of the “Materials in art” series. Shows the use of fibre in knotting, stitchery and weaving using a variety of simple looms. Demonstrates an array of techniques that can be used in the classroom. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Festival time
results.creator_credit: V.R. Sarma, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: The festivals, mostly of religious origin, celebrated each year in India including: Holi, the spring festival, marked by fights with colored water, open air performances of the Vedas, and dancing; Gokul Ashtam which celebrates the birth of Lord Krishna; Ganesh, devoted to the god of wisdom; Dusserah, the autumn harvest festival when womanhood is venerated, books and tools of trade are worshipped in thanks for a livelihood and demon effigies are set on fire; Divala, festival of the goddess of wealth, a festival of lights and a special occasion for the trading community.
results.creator_credit_for_label: V.R. Sarma, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India

results.title: Festival in Edinburgh
results.creator_credit: Douglas Clarke, Howard Thomas and Associated British-Pathe
results.brief_description: Scenes from the 1954 Edinburgh Festival of music and drama, including a short sequence showing Margot Fonteyn and Michael Somes dancing ‘The Firebird’, Ann Todd and Paul Rogers in a scene from Macbeth, Sir Adrian Boult conducting the National Youth Orchestra and before the castle.

results.title: Festival 78
results.creator_credit: Christopher Wade, Gil Cardinal and Access Alberta
results.brief_description: Festival 78 was the first cultural festival in Commonwealth history, and was held in conjunction with the XI Commonwealth Games in Edmonton, 1978. As an exchange of culture from all countries there was emphasis on national dancing, and many performances of all kinds took place throughout the city of Edmonton. Written and narrated by Dave Billington.

results.title: Fertilization and birth
results.creator_credit: Curtis Avery and Wexler Film Productions
results.brief_description: Uses animation and live action to describe for young children the reproductive processes from fertilization to birth in fish, birds, animals, and humans. Includes birth sequences of puppies and farm animals. Suitable for primary level.
